column4: hey, i have a LAN broadband connection, in windows, i wrote http://masti/, and a losal (LAN) site opened with movies n stuff on the server. but on ubuntu (firefox) i wrote the same n it takes me to www.masti.com etc, how do i make it open the LAN site specifically
anybody has any idea, i can explain in detail if anyone wants
add an alias in your hosts file
add a line to /etc/hosts where the ip address of the server is first and then mast ie 192.168.0.100 masti
you need to restart the network to have it take effect
: i dont know the IP adress of the server.
the website is on the network, but firefox looks on the internet
and when you modify your hosts file it will check that first and see that it is supposed to look internally and open the server and not take you to masti.com
do you have physical access to the server?
can you ask the admin of the network what the IP address is?
if its the same as the Dell optiplex I had, its an ISA based sound card and I found it easier to install a PCI sound card
does it show up in lspci?
then its probably an isa based card which means getting a PCI sound card would be easier
there is info here (older though so may not work) http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=156334 and https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HowToSetupSoundCards?highlight=%28sound%29
